context: There is a sizeable Greek minority of about <a0_0><b4_0>105,000<b4_0/> (disputed, sources claim higher) people, in Albania. The Greek minority of Turkey<a0_0/>, which numbered upwards of 200,000 people after the 1923 exchange, has now dwindled to a few thousand, after the <a1_0><b5_0>1955<b5_0/> <b6_0>Constantinople Pogrom<b6_0/> and other state sponsored violence and discrimination.<a1_0/> This effectively ended, though not entirely, <a2_0>the <b7_0>three-thousand-year-old presence<b7_0/> of Hellenism in Asia Minor<a2_0/>. There are <a3_0><b8_0>smaller Greek minorities<b8_0/> in the rest of the Balkan countries, the Levant and the Black Sea states,<a3_0/> remnants of the Old Greek Diaspora (pre-19th century).
